alert.note: Alert for Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 8:59PM CDT until July 28 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT FRIDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Bayfield and Sawyer Counties. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 859 PM CDT Thursday, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen over the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hayward, Washburn, Iron River, Round Lake, Cable, Barnes, Barksdale, Oulu, Drummond, Town of Delta, Namekagon Lake, Ino, Benoit, Namekagon, Seeley, Spider Lake, Mason, Lake Owen, Grand View and Totagatic Lake. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612.
